DOC.brief_summary: It well know postmenopausal woman risk osteoporosis . The study hypothesis vitamin D deficiency ( ≤17.5nmol/L ) frequently associate osteomalacia cause low BMD estimation DXA scan due insufficient bone mineralization . We assume among postmenopausal woman , Vitamin D treatment improve bone mineralization cause rapid increase BMD . According result , bisphosphonates therapy may unnecessary treatment . The objective study evaluate impact severe vitamin D deficiency correction Bone Mineral Density ( BMD ) postmenopausal woman .
DOC.brief_title: The Impact Severe Vitamin D Deficiency Its Correction Bone Mineral Density ( BMD ) Postmenopausal Women
DOC.criteria: 1 . Signed Informed Consent . 2 . Female age 5570 3 . At least 2 year past menopause 4 . 25 ( OH ) D≤ 17.5nmol/L ( ≤7 ng/ml ) 1 . Vitamin D level > 30nmol/L past 2 year 2 . Creatinine > 1.2 % mg 3 . Calcium ≥ 10.2mg/dl 4 . Current previous vitamin D treatment 2 week 5 . Previous vitamin D treatment 2 month past 2 year 6 . BMI > 35 BMI < 20 7 . Menopause age 45 8 . Type 1 diabetes 9 . Concomitant disease : 1 . Malabsorptive disease ( Cystic Fibrosis , Crohn 's , gastric bypass surgery , celiac disease ) 2 . Rheumatoid arthritis 3 . Nephrotic syndrome 4 . Chronic renal failure 5 . Primary hyperparathyroidism 6 . Hyperthyroidism 7 . Malignancies exclude skin cancer ( within last 5 year ) 8 . Kidney stone history renal colic 10 . Medications : 9 . Steroids use ( past present ) 10 . Anti rejection drug last 5 year 11 . Anticonvulsant ( carbamezapine , hydantoin , Phenobarbital etc ) last 5 year 12 . Any anti osteoporotic medication : Prolia , Bisphosphonates , Teriperatide , Evista , Protelos , ( past present ) 13 . Post menopausal HRT ( last 10 year ) 14 . Aromatase inhibitor : Femara , Arimadex ( past present ) 15 . Current use PPIs ( lanton , controloc , zoton , omepradex etc ) 16 . Current past use anti depressant SSRI ( favoxil , cipralex etc )
